title: Royal Mail admits to breaking competition law with cartel on parcel deliveries
text:
Royal Mail was part of a cartel that meant customers paid over the odds for parcel deliveries for more than four years.

Regulator Ofcom said Royal Mail worked with SaleGroup, a reseller of delivery services, on an “illegal anti-competitive agreement”, which meant they did not compete for each other’s customers.

SaleGroup is an online business that arranges deliveries for small and medium-sized business customers by sourcing multiple parcel operators, rather than carrying out deliveries itself.

Royal Mail’s Parcelforce division and SaleGroup, trading as Despatch Bay, agreed a deal whereby they shared information on customers between August 2013 and May 2018.
